enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and fourteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the National Peace Officers Memorial Service and the National Honor Guard and Pipe Band Exhibition.

header.#text: Use of the Capitol Grounds for National Peace Officers Memorial Service

quote.#tail: ), on the Capitol Grounds, in order to honor the law enforcement officers who died in the line of duty during 2013.

text.#text: The Grand Lodge of the Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary shall be permitted to sponsor a public event, the 33rd Annual National Peace Officers Memorial Service (in this resolution referred to as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: jointly designate, with preparation for the event to begin on May 12, 2014.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate

text.#text: The Memorial Service shall be held on May 15, 2014, or on such other date as the

header.#text: Use of the Capitol Grounds for National Honor Guard and Pipe Band Exhibition

quote.#tail: ), on the Capitol Grounds, in order to allow law enforcement representatives to exhibit their ability to demonstrate Honor Guard programs and provide for a bag pipe exhibition.

text.#text: The Grand Lodge of the Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary shall be permitted to sponsor a public event, the National Honor Guard and Pipe Band Exhibition (in this resolution referred to as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate

text.#text: The exhibition shall be held on May 14, 2014, or on such other date as the
Under conditions to be prescribed by the
free of admission charge and open to the public; and
arranged not to interfere with the needs of
The sponsors of the Memorial Service and Exhibition shall assume full responsibility for all expenses and liabilities incident to all activities associated with the events.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: are authorized to erect upon the Capitol Grounds such stage, sound amplification devices, and other related structures and equipment, as may be required for the Memorial Service and Exhibition.

text.#text: Subject to the approval of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide for enforcement of the restrictions contained in
, concerning sales, advertisements, displays, and solicitations on the Capitol Grounds, as well as other restrictions applicable to the Capitol Grounds, in connection with the events.

role.#text: Clerk of the House of Representatives.
